message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: List<String> list1 = Arrays.asList("APPLE", "PEAR");
List<String> list2 = Arrays.asList("BANANA", "ORANGE");
List<String> result = new ArrayList<>();

Iterator<String> iterator1 = list1.iterator();
Iterator<String> iterator2 = list2.iterator();

while (iterator1.hasNext() && iterator2.hasNext()) {
    result.add(iterator1.next() + iterator2.next());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use two iterators to iterate over both lists simultaneously. In each iteration, you can concatenate the elements from both lists and add the result to a new list.
